page.title: 14MR C.W.CRAMP
page.content: Mr. Cramp has run a family jewellery business in West street for many years. He was born in Horsham in 1914 and says he was a war baby! He remembers his childhood in the the flats above the shop when he went up to bed with a candle for light. Electricity was connected into his house in 1928. Entertainment has changed very much in his lifetime. He recalls radio sets coming in about 1920 and the gramaphone a few years later. Shopping is another area that Mr. Cramp has seen seen change over the years. He remembers the arrival of Woolworths in Horsham which closed in 1984 and how the arrival of supermarkets has changed people's shopping habits in Horsham.
